title: Importance of Balance in Health
content: The importance of balance at all stages of life is appreciated by everyone, but as we age, the consequences of losing your balance tip from inconvenient to devastating to potentially life-ending. There are many ways to train for balance, ranging from walking on uneven surfaces to walking on a tightrope or zipline. A big piece of balance, and the part that probably matters most for your healthspan, is lower leg variability, or 'problem solving with your feet.' Most of us have nowhere near the variability and proprioception with our feet that we have with our hands, which makes it much harder for us to maintain balance than it should be. We must have the ability to shift weight, accelerate and decelerate our mass through different parts of the feet in order to respond and stabilize appropriately to changes in our environment.

title: Balance Board Usage
content: Playing with a balance board doesn't help in gaining the 'feels' with feet. Using foot and lower leg to respond to weight shifts.
